sentences.sContent: Mr. Morris said the victims had suffered from a very grievous mistake.
sentences.sCn: 莫里斯先生说受害者们为一个非常严重的失误而受苦。

remMethod.val: griev (看作grief， 悲痛) + ous (…的) → 悲痛的 → 令人忧伤的

words.tran: 令人悲伤地；极其痛苦地

trans.tranOther: If you describe something such as a loss as grievous, you mean that it is extremely serious or worrying in its effects
